title: Providing facilities for the Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Patients to carry out the Dialysis System  at home
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to implement a pilot project for the use of automated peritoneal dialysis in home setting for the patients of the Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown origin and the Chronic Kidney Disease patients. A sum of Rs.500 million has been set apart by the Budget of 2019 for the implementation of this project. It has been observed that this activity has contributed to prolonging the life span of the kidney patients and   bestowing a better outcome of their lives. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health, Nutrition & Indigenous Medicine, to enter into an Agreement with M/s Lucenxia Healthcare (Pvt.) Ltd. for the implementation of the project ,for a period of 08 years at the rate of Rs.103,740/- per patient per month, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.
